block.p: Perhaps despite Derek Jeter's outstanding World Series play (Sports pages, Oct. 27), an even more valuable player was Mike Piazza. His restrained and mature response to Roger Clemens's absurd behavior kept the Series from becoming a circus of hostility and was the kind of example we hope star athletes will give to their younger admirers.

Perhaps despite Derek Jeter's outstanding World Series play (Sports pages, Oct. 27), an even more valuable player was Mike Piazza. His restrained and mature response to Roger Clemens's absurd behavior kept the Series from becoming a circus of hostility and was the kind of example we hope star athletes will give to their younger admirers.

That's why this Yankee fan was rooting for Piazza's long fly ball to make it over the wall and tie the game in the ninth inning on Thursday night (with the Yankees, of course, then going on to win in extra innings).
WALTER GRAY Mount Kisco, N.Y., Oct. 27, 2000
